definition: ox/cow/bull/CL:條|条[tiao2],頭|头[tou2]/newton (abbr. for 牛頓|牛顿[niu2 dun4])/(slang) awesome
meat/flesh/pulp (of a fruit)/(coll.) (of a fruit) squashy/(of a person) flabby/irresolute/Kangxi radical 130

sentences.english: Please let us have two veals.
And what meat will you have? The mutton is very good, and so is the roast veal.
sentences.chinese: 你要什麼肉？這裏羊肉非常好，烤的小牛肉也不錯。

sentences.english: I put the veal scallops into the refrigerator before they could spoil.
sentences.chinese: 在小牛肉可能變質前，我把它們擱在冰箱裏。

sentences.english: Veal carpaccio, truffle, pickled morel mushroom.
sentences.chinese: 生薄小牛肉片，黑松露，醃製羊肚菌。

sentences.english: He cut the veal into cutlets.
Hey, Jack, which do you prefer, mutton or veal?
sentences.chinese: 嘿，傑克，你更喜歡哪一種，羊肉或小牛肉？

sentences.english: Enjoy with richly flavoured meat dishes like osso bucco and lamb daube.
sentences.chinese: 配新鮮風味的肉餐，如燉小牛肉和紅酒燉羊肉。

sentences.english: I should like a veal cutlet.
sentences.chinese: 我很想喫一客小牛肉片。

sentences.english: I prefer a charred lamb cutlet with chutney.
sentences.chinese: 我很想喫一客小牛肉片。

definition: rice in gravy, typically with meat and vegetables
